discussion.content: D. The rating for the web site www.bing.com has been locally overridden to a category that is being blocked

choices.B: The user has not authenticated with the FortiGate yet.
choices.C: The web server IP address 204.79.197.200 is categorized by FortiGuard as Malicious Websites.
choices.D: The rating for the web site www.bing.com has been locally overridden to a category that is being blocked.
choices.A: The web site www.bing.com is categorized by FortiGuard as Malicious Websites.

discussion.content: Correct Answer A&D : Fortigate Infrastructure 6.2 Study Guide page : 276

comments.content: But C is stating that we're going to ensure a minimum of 32kbps which is less than the required minimum. As JesseJames has stated above.

discussion.content: c & d, Ensure the Collector agent has at least 64kbps bandwidth to the FortiGate unit. If not, information FSSO information may not reach the FortiGate unit resulting in outages. The best solution is to configure traffic shaping between the FortiGate unit and the Collector agent to ensure that minimum bandwidth is always available. Ensure the Collector agent has at least 64kbps bandwidth to the FortiGate unit. If not, information FSSO information may not reach the FortiGate unit resulting in outages. The best solution is to configure traffic shaping between the FortiGate unit and the Collector agent to ensure that minimum bandwidth is always available.

comments.content: I can't edit my comment, but I would say A&D is correct. C is stating 34kbs when the article that @sethjam listed says at least 64kbps bandwidth to the FortiGate unit

choices.C: Guarantee at least 34 Kbps bandwidth between FortiGate and domain controllers.
choices.A: Include the group of guest users in a policy.
choices.D: Ensure all firewalls allow the FSSO required ports.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements are best practices for troubleshooting FSSO? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: ANswer is C when overide is enable

C. 
Connected monitored ports > priority > HA uptime > serial number - override enabled
 Connected monitored ports > HA uptime> priority > serial number - override disabled(deafult)
FortiGate Infrastructure study guide 6.2 pg.293

The answer is C
https://help.fortinet.com/fos50hlp/54/Content/FortiOS/fortigate-high-availability-52/HA_FGCP_override.htm

Note that the question says the override option is enabled...

questions.question_text: When override is enabled, which of the following shows the process and selection criteria that are used to elect the primary FortiGate in an HA cluster?

choices.D: HA uptime > priority > Connected monitored ports > serial number
choices.C: Connected monitored ports > priority > HA uptime > serial number
choices.A: Connected monitored ports > HA uptime > priority > serial number
choices.B: Priority > Connected monitored ports > HA uptime > serial number

discussion.content: B&C - IPS Filter is set to not generate any packer log, so A is not correct.
A & B are correct. Individual signature actions override filter actions. So Monitor and Log actions will take place.

B&C
Each IPS sensor consists of two parts: filters and overrides. Overrides are always checked before filters.
A & C correct, but B can be correct, action - monitor

comments.content: B cannot be correct. The A32S.Botnet attacker will be blocked if they target windows OS

The signature overrides the Filter, so it will be allowed as "Monitor". 

A canÂ´t be correct since all the traffic matching IPS filter (blocked traffic) will NOT generate log.
The block log will not be recorded

choices.B: The sensor will not block attackers matching the A32S.Botnet signature.
choices.C: The sensor will block all attacks for Windows servers.
choices.A: The sensor will gather a packet log for all matched traffic.
choices.D: The sensor will reset all connections that match these signatures.
